Leon Seal wrote:
> Hi everyone,
> I have some questions how Heritrix behave when it revisit the website.
> If I have two crawl orders with default setting, then how Heritrix 
> behave in the second crawl. Doed it re-crawl every web pages or just 
> the changed one ?
Yes.  The second crawl will re-fetch all pages though they may have been 
just-fetched by a previous crawl.

By default, a Heritrix crawl has no knowledge of previous crawls.  It 
will always attempt downloading pages that fall within the defined 
scope.  The AdaptiveRevisit Frontier tries to improve on this state of 
affairs. In brief, the AdaptiveRevisit Frontier keeps around a 
fingerprint of pages downloaded and if no change between subsequent  
downloads, it  adjusts the revisit interval so slow changing pages are 
visited at a lesser frequency.

> Or if I using the AdaptiveRevisitFrontier, how Heritrix do when 
> revisiting the webpage. Does it record only the changed page or the 
> whole website again ? How can I check whether it retrieve the changed 
> page only or not?
To be clear, to know if a page has changed, the crawler first has to 
download it.

I believe the AdaptiveRevisit Frontier acts at the page level so it will 
revisit fast-changing pages at a higher frequency (So, yes, it will only 
download the changed pages rather than all pages of a site).

As to how you can check what the AR Frontier is downloading, study the 
crawl.log.  It  makes a detailed note of all the crawler downloads.

Hope this helps,
